Package com.cm.projects.spring.resource.chasis

Class ChasisResource<T,​E extends java.io.Serializable,​R>

java.lang.Object
com.cm.projects.spring.resource.chasis.ChasisResource<T,​E,​R>
Type Parameters:
T - action entity
E - id class
R - Edited entity
public class ChasisResource<T,​E extends java.io.Serializable,​R>
extends java.lang.Object
Exposes the following resource actions;
  • Create new resource
  • Update existing resource
  • Delete existing resource
  • Approve checker actions
  • Decline checker actions
  • Fetch, filter, search and paginate resources
Version:
0.0.1
Author:
Cornelius M

  • Method Details

    • create

      @RequestMapping(method=POST) @Transactional public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ResponseWrapper<E>> create​(@Valid @RequestBody T t)
      Used to persist new entities to the database. The following validations are carried out before an entity is persisted:

      Validations

      • Javax Validation i.e @NotNull, @Size
      • Unique Fields (Fields annotated with @Unique annotation
      • Validates if @ManyToOne entity exists
      Note
      If an id field is present on the entity it will be reset to null.
      Parameters:
      t - New entity to be persisted
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with statuses:
      • 201 on success
      • 409 on unique validation error
      • 400 on validation error
      • 404 for @ManyToOne entities that don't exist

    • getEntity

      @RequestMapping(value="/{id}", method=GET) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ResponseWrapper<T>> getEntity​(@PathVariable("id") E id)
      Used to fetch entity by id
      Parameters:
      id - Entity id
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with data field containing the entity (data is null when entity could not be found) and status 200:

    • updateEntity

      @RequestMapping(method=PUT) @Transactional public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ResponseWrapper<java.util.List<java.lang.String>>> updateEntity​(@RequestBody @Valid T t) throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException, com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException, ExpectationFailed, java.lang.NoSuchMethodException, java.lang.InstantiationException, java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
      Used to update entities by saving new changes to the edited record entity. For edited record to work The following annotation must be present on the relevant fields to be used to store changes;
      • @EditEntity used to store the name of the entity being updated preferably should be a string For example

        @EditEntity
        private String recordEntity;

      • @EditDataWrapper used to store changes in JSON format preferably should be a String For example

        @EditDataWrapper
        private String data;

      • @EditEntityId used to store entity id and you can use any data type that extends Serializable For example

        @EditEntityId
        private Long entityId;

      Note

      For created and updated records that have not been approved the changes are persisted to the entity directly without being stored in the edited record entity. Also if entity doesn't have status field entity is persisted directly
      Parameters:
      t - entity containing new changes
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with statuses:
      • 200 on success
      • 404 if the entity doesn't exist in the database
      • 400 on validation errors (Relies on javax validation)
      • 409 on unique field validation errors
      • 417 if the entity us pending approval actions or if changes were not found on the current entity
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if a field on the entity could not be accessed
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException - if changes could not be converted to json string
      ExpectationFailed - When editEntity does not have fields; @EditEntity, EditEntity and EditEntityId
      java.lang.NoSuchMethodException
      java.lang.InstantiationException
      java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException

    • deleteEntity

      @RequestMapping(method=DELETE) @Transactional public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ResponseWrapper> deleteEntity​(@RequestBody @Valid @Valid ActionWrapper<E> actions) throws java.lang.NoSuchMethodException, java.lang.InstantiationException, java.lang.IllegalAccessException, java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
      Used to delete entities.

      Note

      If action and actionStatus fields don't exist the record is moved to trash directly (flagging . If intrash field doesn't exist the record is deleted permanently
      Parameters:
      actions - contains an array of entity id(s)
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with statuses:
      • 200 on success
      • 207 if not all records could be deleted
      • 404 if the entity doesn't exist in the database
      Throws:
      java.lang.NoSuchMethodException
      java.lang.InstantiationException
      java.lang.IllegalAccessException
      java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException

    • declineActions

      @RequestMapping(value="/decline-actions", method=PUT) @Transactional public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ResponseWrapper> declineActions​(@RequestBody @Valid @Valid ActionWrapper<E> actions) throws java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException, java.lang.NoSuchMethodException, java.lang.InstantiationException, java.lang.IllegalAccessException
      Used to decline actions (create, update, delete, deactivate). Ensures only the checker can decline an action
      Parameters:
      actions -
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with statuses:
      • 200 on success
      • 404 if the entity doesn't exist in the database
      • 207 if some of the action could be approved successfuly. The data fields contains more details on records that failed
      Throws:
      ExpectationFailed - When entity doesn't have action or actionStatus fields
      java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
      java.lang.NoSuchMethodException
      java.lang.InstantiationException
      java.lang.IllegalAccessException

    • fetchChanges

      @RequestMapping(method=GET, value="/{id}/changes") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ResponseWrapper<java.util.List<java.lang.String>>> fetchChanges​(@PathVariable("id") E id) throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException, java.io.IOException
      Used to fetch entity updated changes
      Parameters:
      id - entity id to be effected
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with status 200 and a List of changes (Returns an empty list if changes don't exist)
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if a field on the entity could not be accessed
      java.io.IOException - if stored changes could not be read
      See Also:
      SupportRepository.fetchChanges(Serializable, Object)

    • fetchEntity

      public T fetchEntity​(java.io.Serializable id)
      Fetch entity excluding entities in trash
      Parameters:
      id -
      Returns:

    • findAll

      @GetMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ResponseWrapper<org.springframework.data.domain.Page<T>>> findAll​(org.springframework.data.domain.Pageable pg, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request) throws java.text.ParseException
      Used to retrieve all entity records.

      Note

      • If needle parameter is present search will be done on fields annotated with @Searchable (Search is case insensitive)
      • If fields annotated with @Filter exist the request will be searched for parameters with similar name as the field name and if found the results will be filtered using the filter. For example for field 
        @Filter private String name;
        expects the request name parameter to be name. To filter by date range you need to provide to and from request parameters with a valid String date (dd/MM/yyyy, dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm:ss.SSS, dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm:ss)
      Parameters:
      pg - used to sort and limit the result
      request - HTTP Request used to get filter and search parameters.
      Returns:
      Throws:
      java.text.ParseException - if request param date cannot be casted to Date

    • deactivateRecord

      @PutMapping("/deactivate") @Transactional public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ResponseWrapper<java.util.List<java.lang.String>>> deactivateRecord​(@RequestBody @Valid @Valid ActionWrapper<E> actions) throws java.lang.NoSuchMethodException, java.lang.InstantiationException, java.lang.IllegalAccessException, java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
      Used to deactivate entities.
      Parameters:

      Throws:

      java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException

    • exportCsv

      @GetMapping("/export.csv") public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView exportCsv​(org.springframework.data.domain.Pageable pg, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request) throws java.text.ParseException
